p: Overall, only 12.9% (31/240) of participants recalled having had dengue, despite very high serological evidence of previous DENV exposure. All participants who recalled having dengue in the past showed dengue IgG seropositivity. Of these, 18 were hospitalized and another 13 were treated on an outpatient basis, and all had complete resolution of symptoms. Amongst participants who had serological evidence suggesting past DENV infections, only 9.6% (20/209) reported having dengue previously. Amongst those with recent DENV infections, 35.5% (11/31) recalled having dengue.
